greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the generalized Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A(16).
comment: Also known as the 16th Bendersky constant.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
formula: A(k) = exp(H(k)*B(k+1)/(k+1) - zeta'(-k)), where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number, H(k) the k-th harmonic number, and zeta'(x) is the derivative of the Riemann Zeta function.
A(16) = exp(-16! * Zeta(17) / (2^17 * Pi^16)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 01 2016
results.author: _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 31 2015
